Case reference: 2018062818.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1993, at approximately 1:30am, Rafat Abugazia was last seen by his roommate in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015045751.CaseDesc: On August 26, 2015 Lester Sampson was reported missing from Glen Vowell First Nation Village in B.C. This community is located on the west side of the Skeena River between Hazelton and Kispiox. Mr. Sampson’s brother last saw him at his residence in Glen Vowell on August 25, 2015.

Case reference: 2014001425.CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2012020108.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2006, Tommy Clément-Pépin was seen for the last time at approximately 11:00 a.m., in a hotel in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec. His vehicle was located in a parking lot in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec.

Case reference: 2008020999.CaseDesc: Dave MacDermott was last seen on or about Saturday November 9, 2002 in Kitchener, Ontario. He had been out celebrating a friend’s birthday. It was initially reported that Dave left town with his dog and his 1990 Ford Mustang. However, his vehicle was located parked in a parking lot near his residence and his dog was found wandering the neighbourhood.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some missing teeth with some decay; he has cracked lower left teeth
Boots: Black, Motorcycle boots with a buckle on each boot
Tattoo: Torso (Back), small ladybug between shoulder blades

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2014004626.CaseDesc: In March of 1975, “Rocky” FIDDLER, 14 years old, was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned, as a result of the investigation, that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2014001801.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes

Case reference: 2005007499.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 50-60 years, was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist boarding dock. His post-mortem weight was recorded as 127.5lbs. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'3''-5'4''; however, due to traumatic injury this may not accurately represent his actual living height. He was recovered without clothing or personal effects. It is not known how long he had been in the water. A man, similarly described, was seen jumping over the Niagara Falls 5 days prior to the date that this unidentified man was recovered.

Hair: Grey, White, It is unknown whether he had any scalp hair but a few white hairs were noted on the back of his neck
Teeth: Several of his teeth were missing prior to his death and he has some fillings. He also has a cast chrome partial upper denture.
Mark: Left Side Of Head, Raised "age spots" on his head, left cheek and behind his left ear.
Deformity: Upper Left Back, A papilloma (benign non-cancerous tumor) over his left shoulder blade
Scar: Right Pelvis, 2cm right inguinal (groin area) scar

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Mr. Beauchamps was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Mr.Beauchamps went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2006019099.CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 2014002458.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1986, Rozebeh Kiani was seen for the last time in the Shaughnessy Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Rozebeh left all his personal belongings behind in his apartment and it is possible he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Kiani speaks very little French or English.

Case reference: 2013000104.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of March 8, 1985, an unidentified male was seen walking on the Miles Hart Bridge. Ten minutes later, one witness returned only to discover a pile of clothing. The clothing was later identified as belonging to Mr. Beardy. It is assumed Mr. Beardy took his own life, however his remains have never been recovered. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014005617.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Wylie Coyote holding a beer mug

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2013000135.CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.

Case reference: 2014005727.CaseDesc: Ryan Slobodzian was last seen when he was dropped off on Henry Avenue. Mr. Slobodzian has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Backpack: Unknown, May have been carrying at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2018046052.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1997, Eric Wong was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Eric was in Canada continuing his education and had contacted his mother in October 1997 for help with his tuition fees.

Case reference: 2014000003.CaseDesc: The Toronto Police Service is seeking assistance in solving a missing person case.  Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.

Jacket: Cotton, Black, waist length; zippered front
Scar: Nose, Small scar on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014004820.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2006, William Teya was seen for the last time in Fort McPherson, Northwest Territories.

Jacket: Black, Dark; E. Gruben Transport on left chest

Case reference: 2014005555.CaseDesc: In April, 2000, Magdalena Ciesek was last seen in Toronto, Ontario at the intersection of Dundas Street W. and Roncesvalles Avenue.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020056.CaseDesc: Sylvia Ann Guiboche was last seen around mid June 2003.  Sylvia is known to frequent the Sargent Avenue/Ellice Avenue area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Sylvia is at high risk of being exploited.

Other: Abdomen, Was 6-9 months pregnant at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2014004487.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2015022096.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Karrie-Ann Henry was seen for the last time leaving her home with some of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014001084.CaseDesc: On August 12, 1987, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Franz Run on Whistler Mountain in British Columbia. He may have been from South Africa or the United States. It is estimated that he may have gone missing a year to three years prior and may have been despondent at the time.

Shoes: Leather, White, Nike, Tennis shoes; size 8

Case reference: 2014006708.CaseDesc: On April 22nd, 2014 Andrew George Nicoll was reported missing from his home near Breton, Alberta. He was last seen on April 20, 2014. Extensive searches of his property and the surrounding county were conducted by ground and air. Mr. Nicoll has not been located.

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2006026199.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1976 an unidentified male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Niagara River, Niagara Falls, Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150-200 lbs and his length was measured at 5’5”-6'0", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, The names "Mary and Kim" in blue with a red flower on a green background

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2018062675.CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2006007499.CaseDesc: David Goetz and Lucas Zenger were last seen on August 23, 1992, in the Owen Sound area. They went for a canoe ride.  They travelled down the shoreline along Kepple Township, towards Big Bay. The canoe was located approximately 1.5 miles off Cape Commodore.

Case reference: 2019062090.CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.

Case reference: 2022002122.CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses

Case reference: 2013000129.CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.

Case reference: 2014004876.CaseDesc: In 1999, Fathiya Mohamed was seen for the last time. Fathiya and her family had emigrated from Somalia to England and to different parts of Canada.

Case reference: 2006028499.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1968, at approximately 4:30 p.m., Robert James Brown was last seen walking  from the Nazarene Camp to his home in the Village of Wilfred, Ontario. The Nazarene Camp was a Christian camp near Pefferlaw, where Robert's mother worked as a volunteer.  He never arrived home and was reported missing to the Georgina Township Police Service. There were reports that a person matching Robert's description was seen in the vicinity of Georgina Beach around the time that Robert was last seen. Numerous land and water searches failed to locate Robert.

Case reference: 2011002599.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.

Case reference: 2012020647.CaseDesc:
Ricky Riopel was reported missing in August 2010 by family members who had not seen or heard from him since December 2008. It was later established that Mr. Riopel had been in Moose Jaw at a health care facility in October 2009.   
Investigators now believe the last confirmed sighting of Mr. Riopel was in Saskatoon, at a downtown shopping mall, in September 2010. Mr. Riopel's parents are both failing in health which has prompted this additional request for public assistance.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 2006012299.CaseDesc: On June 02, 1984, Andrew Grinnell, his brother,their cousin and a friend  departed Sioux Lookout on a canoe trip on the Albany River. The party arrived in Fort Albany on July 18, 1984. At 6:00 p.m. that same day, the party decided to leave Fort Albany in an attempt to paddle to Moosonee via James Bay. The group had planned to go out onto James Bay with the tide and sail to Moosonee by lashing their canoes together. An intense storm engulfed the James Bay coastal area on July 23, 1984, and it is likely that the party perished on the Bay during this storm. Three victims were recovered in August 1984, twelve nautical miles North of the Moose River. Mr. Grinnell's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1979, James Caraley was last seen when he went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda in Jasper, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001015.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 30 years old, was found in the County of Wellington on the grounds of a private club called "Clearwater Enterprises Ltd.". His post-mortem length was measured at 5’8”-5’10”, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was a heavy smoker. He was estimated to have been there since August-late September the previous year.

Other: Single blade pocket knife with inscription "Niagara Falls"

Case reference: 2006026799.CaseDesc: On Friday, May 19, 1967, at about 06:10 A.M,. Victor Morris left his cottage on the South Shore of Lake Nipissing in an 18 foot Geisler Cedar Strip boat with an 18 hp motor. On Sunday, May 21 1967, the boat was recovered on Manitou Island in Lake Nipissing. The boat was partially burnt and the motor showed signs of having exploded.

Case reference: 2009000299.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1989 at approximately 5:30 pm, Mr. George Giles and a friend left Mr. Giles' cottage on Fox Island in Lake Simcoe enroute to a marina at Island Grove.  Weather conditions were very poor at the time and the boat eventually capsized some distance from shore, after taking on water. His friend managed to swim back to Fox Island but Mr. Giles was not able to make it to shore, due to the treacherous weather and water conditions. On November 20th, 1989 the boat was discovered stranded on a sandbank near Joyland Beach in Orillia. Mr. Giles' body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2014005526.CaseDesc: Angela Meyer went missing from her parents’ residence. She was on a weekend pass from Stanton Territorial Hospital and under the legal guardianship of her mother. Miss Meyer had gone outside of the residence for a cigarette and has not been seen since. There were sightings of her walking in the Con Mine area.  She was taking various medications and did not take the medications with her when she went missing.

Jacket: Nylon, Red, Black, Hip length, black on the back of sleeves

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2014002595.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1997, John Grabluk was seen for the last time at the Scarborough Postal Union Office in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, John had taken a leave of absence.

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2014004179.CaseDesc: Leona Brule from Fort Providence, NT, was reported missing by her mother in 1989.  Her mother had not heard from Leona for over a year.  Leona was considered transient at the time of her disappearance, and drug and alcohol use/abuse was suspected.  Some evidence indicated that Leona may have been on the streets in Edmonton AB in the1990's.  There was also a possible link to Florida.  Leona's disappearance was deemed suspicious from the onset due to high risk transient lifestyle.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 7 teeth treated, 5 absent.

Case reference: 2014005624.CaseDesc: Heinz Paul was last seen filling his vehicle with gas in Calgary, Alberta then driving west. Police investigations regarding Mr. Paul's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2006005899.CaseDesc:
On August 19, 1994, the body of a Caucasian male was found in the Niagara River. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 134 lbs and his length was measured between 5’8"-5’9",  however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix was present. He is believed to have been in the water several days to weeks.

Teeth: Teeth were natural, a few restorations on his lower right posterior teeth.
Scar: Front surface of his left wrist, 1cm in length
Inner surface of his right wrist, 1cm in length
Two scars on his left forehead, 1cm-2cm in length

Case reference: 2010001399.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2009, Trevor Andrews was seen for the last time when he left a friend's house in a residential area of London, Ontario, intending to catch a bus to go home. He never returned home to his father's apartment. It cannot be confirmed that he got on the bus. Trevor is known to be very sociable. He would be noticed because of his energetic behaviour. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Case reference: 2014004248.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1979, at approximately 5:00 a.m., Myrna Montgrand was seen for the last time outside of a residence in La Loche, Saskatchewan. Earlier that morning, Myrna had been with a group of people at a party. Searches and investigation have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014002337.CaseDesc: Timothy Peifer was last seen on the long weekend in September, 2002 in the Caddy Lake area of Manitoba.  Mr. Peifer's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014006229.CaseDesc: In 1981, Cyril Thistle was seen for the last time when he was out on day parole and visiting his sister.  There is reason to believe that Mr. Thistle lived a transient lifestyle as he was known in Toronto, Ontario and on the west coast of Canada.

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.

Case reference: 2006009399.CaseDesc: Patrick Ukrainetz departed his mother's house in St. Isidore, Ontario which he did periodically, but always returned.  On December 26, 2001, Mr. Ukrainetz was captured on a video surveillance camera at a bank in St. Sauveur, in the Province of Quebec. There has not been any other activity on the bank account since that time and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005806.CaseDesc: Roderic Maynard was last seen on Salt Spring Island, BC.  Mr. Maynard had personal issues and departed the area telling friends he intended on attending rehab for treatment of alcohol abuse.  Mr. Maynard is an avid sailor and has travelled all over the world.  Mr. Maynard was employed operating ferries around the Vancouver/Victoria area and would have no problem finding employment operating large water vessels or sail boats.  He is familiar with sailing all around the world and planned to retire in the St. Maarten area.

Mark: Left Cheek, large mole under eye

Case reference: 2014003070.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1996, Yolande Trudeau Laberge was seen for the last time near the Larocque Bridge in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Quebec. Yolande has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Arm, Under arm, approximately 1 inch

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth
Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2015015739.CaseDesc: On October 5, 2014, at approximately 12:40 pm, the body of a black woman was seen floating near the bank of the Rivière des Prairies in the Saint-François district of Laval. She had no identification.

Tattoo: Left Wrist, African symbol-Adinkra-Hye won hye

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014006419.CaseDesc: On January 23, 2014, Ally Hassan Mabruki was seen for the last time at one of Toronto's Refugee Intake Shelters in Ontario. Staff members overheard Ally stating he was going to visit his lawyer regarding his refugee claim.

Case reference: 2014004812.CaseDesc: Grant MOFFAT attended the Fas Gas outlet at the junction of HWY 5 and PTH 68. Here he purchased a fishing license. MOFFAT was at this location for about 20 minutes and did not seem to be in a hurry. On August 20, 2006 the vehicle belonging to MOFFAT was located on HWY 481 about 3 km west of Crane River. The vehicle had not been reported stolen. The whereabouts of MOFFAT remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014003163.CaseDesc: John Timothy McCarthy was last seen in Red Deer, Alberta on May 1, 1991. His van was located in Sault St Marie, Ontario, however it is not known if he stayed in the Ontario region or went on to the United States.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Wedding ring with small diamonds

Case reference: 2014003872.CaseDesc: Diane Bélanger was last seen on August 8, 1982, in the Ville-Marie borough of Montreal, Quebec. Diane hasn’t been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014005607.CaseDesc: Eleanor Eatha Parkinson-Jenkins was last seen on Monday March 1, 1982. At that time, she was living in Saint-Bruno-de Montarville. She was reported missing by her family. Ms. Parkinson-Jenkins had been ill for the past six months. She would normally leave a note when she left, but not that morning. She usually spent her days in bed or never went out alone. She would have left after the departure of her husband and did not take her purse with her. She left on foot and never came back. She is a originally from Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008015499.CaseDesc: Sheryl Sheppard was last seen on January 2 1998, on Lundy's Lane in Niagara Falls, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Hamilton Police Service was conducted but Sheryl Sheppard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2006011699.CaseDesc: Justin Pollari is from St. Joseph Island, Ontario, and was last seen on Friday, December 7, 2001. He is known to be an avid skateboarder and may frequent areas where this sport is practised.

Hair: Blonde, Sometimes worn in a "Mohawk" style
Jewelry: Wood, Nametag with the inscription of "Woody"

Case reference: 2014003787.CaseDesc: Jo Ann Comeau, was last seen on February 9th, 2001, in Saint John, NB. Joanne suffers from Muscular Dystrophy and walks with an unsteady gait.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014005915.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2012, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Frank Fuernkranz was seen for the last time on vacation in Panama. Frank had left to go for a walk, but never returned.

Case reference: 2021015656.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2017, Ann Victor-Lazarus was seen for the last time as she left her home to go to church. Ann’s vehicle was found in a parking lot near the “Parking Authority Water Intakes” on the Niagara River Parkway in Niagara Falls, New York State. Her personal belongings, as well as a note, were found in her vehicle. Ann was captured on video surveillance near the railing of the waterway.

Case reference: 2005004199.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, this male was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 8 miles north of Port Weller. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 156 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He had likely been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Natural teeth with restorations of his upper and lower posterior teeth.

Case reference: 2016061964.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1976, an unidentified Caucasian man, believed to be between the ages of 55 to 60 years old, was found in an abandoned blue van near 21 Blackburn Avenue, Toronto. He was malnourished, very dirty and heavily infested with lice. Locals knew him to live under the bridge at the foot of Blackburn Ave for about 15 years and he was known to local children as old Billy. He was circumcised. His feet showed frostbite which had become infected.

Hair: Grey, Long, Frontal balding and a grey beard 3 inches long
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had a few scattered carious teeth

Case reference: 2014005273.CaseDesc: Elaine Frieda Alook was last seen on May 11, 2004, on Tower road, outside of Fort McMurray, Alberta.

Scar: Lower Back, She had a cast from her wrist to elbow on her left arm

Case reference: 2015027786.CaseDesc: On May, 28, 2015, Jessica Heppner was reported missing by a friend and travelling companion. Jessica was visiting St. John's Newfoundland and was staying at the Sheraton Hotel. She was known to utilize Taxi Cabs as a mode of transportation. She never returned to the hotel to get her belongings.

Case reference: 2012020122.CaseDesc: Robert Bishara was last seen during the evening of March 17th, 2009 in Brossard, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, he was driving a black 2006 Chevrolet Trailblazer 2006 bearing Quebec licence plate 941TBA. The car has not been located. Robert originates from Egypt and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014001731.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1987, Russell Atkinson was last seen boarding a Greyhound bus in Penticton, British Columbia. The bus was destined for Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Russell did not arrive in Winnipeg but his luggage was found on the bus.

Case reference: 2015011650.CaseDesc: On June 15, 2000, the Coast Guard noticed the body of a male floating in the waters of the Saint Lawrence River near the Port of Montreal wharf.

Teeth: Other, Sup. maxillary- dental prosthesis. Inf. maxillary- no teeth
Jewelry: Brown, Wooden cross pendant with leather cord.
Socks: Green, Grey, Green top with grey foot
Boots: Brown, Isolated 120, plus protector, with laces
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-shirt, written "BEAT MOLSON DRY" "BEAT STAFF MOLSON DRY"
Coat: Nylon, Black, Synthetic lining, imitation sheep. Hooded, size medium

Case reference: 2014011272.CaseDesc: During the morning of June 10, 2014, Yvonne Wallace left her residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2010003899.CaseDesc: Pierre Mercon, age 21, a lifelong resident of Vaughan, Ontario, was last seen at approximately 2:00 A.M. on November 1st, 1996. He was observed leaving the "Original Six" Sports Bar, located on Oxford Street in the Town of Richmond Hill, where he had attended a Halloween Party and was last seen wearing a costume of Army fatigues, work boots, a green wool hat and a long black wig. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Back of right shoulder, tattoo of Uruguay

Case reference: 2014003903.CaseDesc: Anthony Kootenay walked away from the Algar Tower fire camp 73 kilometres south of Fort McMurray, Alberta on July 13, 1985 at approximately 3:00 am. In the previous days he was described by colleagues as suffering from mental health issues related to alcohol abuse. It is believed he may have attempted to hitch-hike from the area as a passing motorist spotted someone matching his description. An extensive search by land and helicopter was conducted, however Anthony was not located. Two unconfirmed sightings occurred at the Grand Hotel in Edmonton, AB on December 23, 1985 and January 16, 1986. There have been no sightings since that time.

Shoes: Blue, Running shoes with no laces
Tattoo: Left Hand, Tony on the 4 fingers
Left Arm, A flower with 4 petals
